results.title: World's toughest car trial
results.brief_description:
A film record of the 1953 Redex Car Trial. The film begins with the scrutineering of the cars in Sydney, their start on the official route,
following them through many of the controls and finally concluding with their return to Sydney and the presentation of prizes to winners.

results.title: World's first underwater television grab
results.creator_credit: Pye Film Unit and Meadway Productions
results.brief_description: Documentary account of this pioneering effort in underwater salvage. Underwater cameras are mounted in tandem with a grab, providing remote vision for the grab’s controllers at the water’s surface. Promotional film for television technology developed by the Pye Company of the United Kingdom.

results.title: Workshop for peace. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, Ramakantha Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: A tour of the United Nations building in New York, and an explanation of the function of the United Nations Organisation, the Secretariat, councils and agencies. Shows the unique architecture of the building and the vaious meeting halls. Narrated by John Grueh. Music by Ben Park.

results.title: Workout components
results.creator_credit: Bill Campbell, Mary Ann Reeves and Coaching Association of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Principles of Conditioning the Syncro Swimmer”.
Detailed instructions on the prime components necessary for the conditioning of synchronized swimmers. Tells what to do in the workouts. For CCP Coach levels 1-3. Included are land exercises, sculls, sequences, kicks, ballet legs and drills.

results.title: Workout
results.creator_credit: Ronda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of the relationship between horse and rider during a work out. To compete in Olympic equestrian events young riders must practice daily, sharpening their own skill and that of their horses. Shows the world as it must appear to horse and rider on a foggy morning in the Australian bush.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Workmates
results.brief_description: The story of the training of a pit pony, whose usefulness in the British coal mines is borne out by the fact that, in spite of the increase in mechanisation, thirty-three thousand of the animals are still employed in the mines.

results.title: Workman's nightmare
results.brief_description:
An early experiment filmed in the Straford backyard in Brighton. It features the acting debut of 14 year-old John - as a workman who tussles with an unruly ladder.
This short work from 1951 marked the boys earliest efforts.

results.title: Working: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet style”.
A look at the Soviet economy in the 1970’s. Examines some of the Industrial developments, investigates output, productivity, the relationships between management and the trade unions, and management and individual workers. Also examines working conditions and salaries in a coal mine, a refrigerator factory, a timber processing complex, and dock workers in Odessa

results.title: Working work out
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Changing Australia”.
This is a documentary about unemployment and the resulting social implications in the Newcastle and Wollongong area, which has experienced a downturn in the steel industries.
